page.title: 11FOLKLORE IN NORTH TYNEDALE
page.content: The most famous legend connected with this area is{"The Long Pack".}The story goes that in 1723 the owner of {Lee Hall},a Colonel Ridley, was away in London and left the house in the charge of a maid-servant named Alice and two male servants name Richard and Edward. One afternoon{a pedlar}called requesting a nights lodging and when this was refused he obtained permission to leave his large pack overnight. Later, whilst Alice was examining the pack she saw it move, and she called Richard and Edward. The latter brought a large gun called {Copenhagen}and emptied the contents of the barrel into the pack. Immediately groans were heard and blood flowed from the pack, where a man had been concealed. The three servants were sure that an attack on the house would be made by the mans accomplices.
